title: Washington Football Team signs free agent WR Curtis Samuel
body: The Washington Football Team added to their wide receiver ranks by signing wideout Curtis Samuel to a three-year deal. Sources close to the situation confirmed to ABC7 News. The three-year deal is worth $34.6 million. Samuel is now reunited with former Panthers head coach and current WFT head man Ron Rivera who drafted him in the second round in  NFL Draft. The 5'11' speedy receiver also will also rejoin his former Ohio State teammate Terry McLaurin.
